title: Proposal missing
body:
Hello there. Running Geth v1.11.6, Prysm v4.0.5 and mev-boost v1.5.0
Since Shapella hardfork I've missed all block proposals. 
We tried to find out the reason with Geth team (https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/27138), with Nishant from Prysm team and finally, I hope, find out. It seems something's wrong with mev-boost. 
Here are logs. 
GETH
```
INFO [05-25|17:37:00.338] Starting work on payload                 id=0xbf229667f35a711a
INFO [05-25|17:37:00.354] Updated payload                          id=0xbf229667f35a711a number=17,336,201 hash=cc55fa..d601d5 txs=38   gas=3,174,724 fees=0.004864138539 root=8967e9..855f10 elapsed=16.021ms
INFO [05-25|17:37:02.385] Updated payload                          id=0xbf229667f35a711a number=17,336,201 hash=b17d61..8a1df9 txs=78   gas=6,407,568 fees=0.00885417138  root=09c947..4f22cd elapsed=27.736ms
INFO [05-25|17:37:04.412] Updated payload                          id=0xbf229667f35a711a number=17,336,201 hash=a515c2..da0139 txs=110  gas=8,137,497 fees=0.01486888797  root=e1f251..3b35bf elapsed=24.003ms
INFO [05-25|17:37:06.465] Updated payload                          id=0xbf229667f35a711a number=17,336,201 hash=246119..3bbc52 txs=124  gas=9,005,556 fees=0.01564731379  root=39784e..5459b9 elapsed=51.373ms
INFO [05-25|17:37:08.554] Updated payload                          id=0xbf229667f35a711a number=17,336,201 hash=60ab4e..3c5cb3 txs=155  gas=10,991,513 fees=0.01952288677  root=bd5e6a..67053f elapsed=88.920ms
INFO [05-25|17:37:10.623] Updated payload                          id=0xbf229667f35a711a number=17,336,201 hash=16fd55..86ea0d txs=181  gas=13,330,854 fees=0.02821441559  root=8102ff..d52e51 elapsed=64.576ms
INFO [05-25|17:37:11.563] Stopping work on payload                 id=0xbf229667f35a711a reason=delivery
```

`[2023-05-25 17:37:20] ERROR validator: Failed to propose block blockSlot=6516184 error=rpc error: code = Unknown desc = could not submit blinded block: error posting the SignedBlindedBeaconBlockCapella to the builder api: unsupported error code: 502: did not receive 200 response from API pubKey=0xa4bc0c220ccc`

```

time="2023-05-25T17:37:20+05:00" level=error msg="error making request to relay" blockHash=0xbefbbc79d55b8b6fc2a4799ed9060617ae63f00555528183b9526625e588d68a error="max retries exceeded" method=getPayload parentHash=0xfd55df21f460c21b836b0ea0fbb03fb1cef06fa65f9d7f49d673df757c1c5d69 slot=6516184 url="https://relay.edennetwork.io/eth/v1/builder/blinded_blocks" version=v1.5.0

```

- getHeader returned in time (t=0 at second 11).
- the problem looks to be on the getPayload network request to the Eden relay. either the network connection or the Eden relay ingress seems to have been too slow.

### Same problem here!


My validators started to miss proposals after shapella, that's the 3rd missed. Already tried to remove relays with the worst network delays, but the problem still persists.
I'm a solo validator, far from US and EU, internet link is stable (> 500mb), running ubuntu on vm with 6core amd64, 24GB ram and RAID 1 SSD.

 
MEV-BOOST ( version 1.5.0):


Hi @jpaulomf. looking at the mev-boost logs it looks like the relay is rejecting late `getPayload` requests. The relays now reject requests that come after 4 seconds into the slot: https://github.com/flashbots/mev-boost-relay/blob/b4ceabc27d736f8014de6c1a445abefddbc5d5ec/services/api/service.go#L1311 These getPayload requests are later than the attestation deadline, so they would likely get reorged out anyway (https://www.paradigm.xyz/2023/04/mev-boost-ethereum-consensus for more context on the attestation deadline). The timestamp of your first failed `getPayload` is ``` May 29 13:49:03 ubuntu-bv-node mev-boost[3747]: time="2023-05-29T13:49:03-03:00" level=warning msg="error making request to relay, retrying" blockHash=0x3f2c22c868c5cbf560fc2ea34ea7f2f0be92625a5b52818f3d80b2c8c2d2605c error="HTTP error response: 400 / {\"code\":400,\"message\":\"sent too late - 4448 ms into slot\"}\n" method=getPayload parentHash=0x5eb5e99bbcfb6603e16f2644824d59789277e2fc4260842a0784dac97ac4b821 slot=6546243 url="https://relay.ultrasound.money/eth/v1/builder/blinded_blocks" version=v1.5.0 ``` `May 29 13:49:03`, where the slot started at `13:48:59`. @metachris any idea why mev-boost would be calling getPayload so late?

Probably a slow network connection, and it already being late into the slot until the getHeader response arrives.

Interesting, the getHeader response arrives at :59 already:

```
May 29 13:48:59 ubuntu-bv-node mev-boost[3747]: time="2023-05-29T13:48:59-03:00" level=info msg="http: GET /eth/v1/builder/header/6546243/0x5eb5e99bbcfb6603e16f2644824d59789277e2fc4260842a0784dac97ac4b821/0x85ac602d53116cbeb548316079b107579a70281f1cb549c95902a64031a967bd21282b999c8868079c06fd919420c53f 200" duration=0.331544 method=GET path=/eth/v1/builder/header/6546243/0x5eb5e99bbcfb6603e16f2644824d59789277e2fc4260842a0784dac97ac4b821/0x85ac602d53116cbeb548316079b107579a70281f1cb549c95902a64031a967bd21282b999c8868079c06fd919420c53f status=200 version=v1.5.0
```

In which case, there's 2 options:
1. for some reason the CL client had a lag until it called getPayload
2. due to network latencies, the getPayload request needed a long time to arrive at the relay

Additional logging will be helpful for future cases: https://github.com/flashbots/mev-boost/pull/508

You are talking about slow network connection. 
But it worked perfect before Shapella. Nothing changed, still the same connection. And now 100% missed blocks since Shapella.
